heisig_chinese_memo: At the Grand Canyon there are no buildings, but only little gift shops where tourists can get pretty Grand Canyon embroidery made from high quality thread.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The best embroidery is done with elegant thread.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "糸" and " Su ", the original meaning is painting and embroidery coloring, and all colors are available. "Shuowen": "Five collections and preparations. From the 糸, the sound." "Shu‧Yiji": "Zuohui, Zongyi, Zao, Huo, Fen, Rice, Mi, Fu, 絺, Embroidery, with five The collection is applied to the five-color clothing." Kong Chuan: "Five-color preparation is called embroidery."

" Embroidery " can mean embroidered clothes. "Poetry‧ Tang Feng‧ Yang Zhishui": "Su Yi Zhu Embroidery, Cong Zi Yu Hu."

" Embroidery " also means using colored threads to pierce the cloth into flowers, birds, patterns, etc. "Lun Heng·Cheng Cai" by Wang Chong of Han Dynasty: "Embroidery in the whole world, Heng women are all incompetent."

" Embroidery " also means gorgeous and exquisite. Tang Yinfan's "Heyue Yingling Collection‧ Li Qi": "Qi Poems have clear tunes and embroidered rhetoric, singular songs are salty and good, and profound principles are the longest."

The pattern on the human body is also called " embroidery ". "Water Margin" Chapter 2: "Ask the master craftsman to stab this floral embroidery with him. There are always nine dragons on the shoulders, arms, and chest."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "糸" and " Su ", the original meaning is painting and embroidery.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「肅」聲，本義為繪畫和刺繡設色，五彩俱備。《說文》：「五采備也。从糸，肅聲。」《書‧益稷》：「作會、宗彝、藻、火、粉、米、黼、黻、絺、繡，以五采彰施于五色作服。」孔傳：「五色備曰繡。」

　　「繡」可表示繡花衣服。《詩‧唐風‧揚之水》：「素衣朱繡，從子于鵠。」

　　「繡」也表示用彩色線在布帛上刺成花、鳥、圖案等。漢王充《論衡‧程材》：「齊部世刺繡，恒女無不能。」

　　「繡」還表示華麗、精美。唐殷璠《河岳英靈集‧李頎》：「頎詩發調既清，修辭亦繡，雜歌咸善，玄理最長。」

　　人身上刺的花紋也稱為「繡」。《水滸傳》第2回：「又請高手匠人與他刺了這身花繡，肩、臂、胸膛總有九條龍。」
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「肅」聲，本義為繪畫和刺繡設色，五彩俱備。

從「 糸 」，「 肅 」聲，本義為繪畫和刺繡設色，五彩俱備。《說文》：「五采備也。从糸，肅聲。」《書‧益稷》：「作會、宗彝、藻、火、粉、米、黼、黻、絺、繡，以五采彰施于五色作服。」孔傳：「五色備曰繡。」 「 繡 」可表示繡花衣服。《詩‧唐風‧揚之水》：「素衣朱繡，從子于鵠。」 「 繡 」也表示用彩色線在布帛上刺成花、鳥、圖案等。漢王充《論衡‧程材》：「齊部世刺繡，恒女無不能。」 「 繡 」還表示華麗、精美。唐殷璠《河岳英靈集‧李頎》：「頎詩發調既清，修辭亦繡，雜歌咸善，玄理最長。」 人身上刺的花紋也稱為「 繡 」。《水滸傳》第2回：「又請高手匠人與他刺了這身花繡，肩、臂、胸膛總有九條龍。」
From the sound of " 糸" and " Su", the original meaning is painting and embroidery coloring, and all colors are available. "Shuowen": "Five collections and preparations. From the 糸, the sound." "Shu‧Yiji": "Zuohui, Zongyi, Zao, Huo, Fen, Rice, Mi, Fu, 絺, Embroidery, with five The collection is applied to the five-color clothing." Kong Chuan: "Five-color preparation is called embroidery." " Embroidery" can mean embroidered clothes. "Poetry‧ Tang Feng‧ Yang Zhishui": "Su Yi Zhu Embroidery, Cong Zi Yu Hu." " Embroidery" also means using colored threads to pierce the cloth into flowers, birds, patterns, etc. "Lun Heng·Cheng Cai" by Wang Chong of Han Dynasty: "Embroidery in the whole world, Heng women are all incompetent." " Embroidery" also means gorgeous and exquisite. Tang Yinfan's "Heyue Yingling Collection‧ Li Qi": "Qi Poems have clear tunes and embroidered rhetoric, singular songs are salty and good, and profound principles are the longest." The pattern on the human body is also called " embroidery". "Water Margin" Chapter 2: "Ask the master craftsman to stab this floral embroidery with him. There are always nine dragons on the shoulders, arms, and chest."

繡字的基本解释

繡
xiù
同“绣”。

繡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiù］
［《廣韻》息救切，去宥，心。］
亦作“綉1”。
(1)绘画和刺绣设色，五彩俱备。
(2)绣花衣服。
(3)旧时人身上刺的花纹也称绣。
(4)指各种绣品。
(5)用彩色线在布帛上刺成花、鸟、图案等。
(6)华丽；精美。
(7)姓。汉代有繡君宾，见《汉书·游侠传·原涉》。

繡字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　繡； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页939第18
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?息救切，音秀。【說文】五采備也。【釋名】繡，修也，文修修然也。【書·益稷】黼黻絺繡。【周禮·冬官考工記】畫繢之事，五采備，謂之繡。　又姓。【姓氏急就篇】漢有繡君實。　又【集韻】先彫切，音蕭。【類篇】綺屬。【詩·唐風】素衣朱繡。【箋】繡，當爲綃。【韻補】當讀如肖。

考證：〔【周禮·冬官考工記】畫繢之事，五采備，爲之繡。〕　謹照原文爲之改謂之。

Embroider
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiù］
["Guangyun" to save and cut, go to you, heart. ]
Also known as "Embroidery 1".
(1) Painting, embroidery and coloring, all colors are available.
(2) Embroidered clothes.
(3) The pattern of thorns on a person's body in the old days is also called embroidery.
(4) Refers to all kinds of embroidery.
(5) Use colored threads to stab flowers, birds, patterns, etc. on the cloth.
(6) Gorgeous; exquisite.
(7) Last name. There were embroidered monarchs in the Han Dynasty, see "Hanshu·The Legend of the Ranger·Yuanshe".
